task.title: To Deploy an Docker Image to
task.shortdesc: Terraform is a tool that combines the scripts and credentials required for the deployment. You can use Terraform to deploy an Docker image.

step.cmd: Install Terraform 0.6.3 or higher on your machine and add it to your PATH environment variable.

info.note: For detailed instructions, see the Terraform installation guide.

step.cmd: Download the scripts in a .zip file.
Navigate to the directory that contains the Terraform scripts.

info.note: The .tfvars file contains the cluster credentials and keys.

step.stepresult: Terraform creates the necessary security groups and VM instances, installs Docker, and then installs the Docker images required to run the NATS messaging system.

taskbody.result: The Docker image is deployed as an instance on .
taskbody.postreq: To view the cluster core on , click Project Compute Instance . To view the container host security group, click Project Computer Access and Security .
